content: "I'll know" is a contraction of "I will know," which means that the speaker will have knowledge or information about something in the future. It can be used to indicate confidence or certainty that they will be able to recognize or identify something or that they will have learned something by a certain point in time. For example, "I'll know if the package has arrived when I see it on the doorstep" or "After I study for the exam, I'll know all the answers."
